Description: Neck fragment of North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vase. Inside has a thin wash of paint with added red bands. Outside, below band at top of neck, sphinx, seated to left; remaining are the hindquarters, body, and wing; round incised and unincised rosettes as filling ornament; incision for the outline (except the tail) and for interior details; much added red on the sphinx.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
School of the Paris Dinos. See Alexandria 9565.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 15, no. 44 pl. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.915)
